transliteration: matsyaghāto niṣādānāṁ tvāṣṭistvāyogavasya ca | medāndhracuñcumadgūnām āraṇyapaśuhiṁsanam || 10.48 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The lawful occupation of the Niṣādas is fish-hunting; that of the Tvaṣṭas and Āyogavas is woodcraft; and that of the Medas, Andhras, Cuñcus, and Madgus is the slaughter of wild animals in forests.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from svabhāva-dharma assigned by cosmic order under SPH
Causation aligns with natural capacity and environmental context
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by inherent aptitude and societal role
Restoration logic centers on alignment with one's intrinsic occupational dharma
Consciousness alignment occurs through right engagement within designated roles
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent belongs to Niṣāda group THEN authorize fishing activity within designated zones
IF agent belongs to Tvaṣṭa OR Āyogava group THEN authorize woodworking and related crafts
IF agent belongs to Meda OR Andhra OR Cuñcu OR Madgu group THEN authorize regulated hunting of forest animals
DENY authorization for occupational acts outside svabhāva-dharma without conscious realignment process
RESTORE occupational integrity through capacity affirmation protocols when deviation detected
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, threshold of responsibility is established via svabhāva-dharma verification. Authority flows from alignment with cosmic designation, not individual preference. Cases involving occupational conflict must invoke dharma-realization procedures before determining misalignment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causal alignment between action and svabhāva. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms sequential unfolding of duties based on innate capacity. Responsibility is proportional to awareness of one’s true nature. Non-punitive reality rule ensures correction through realignment rather than suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Svabhāva Affirmation Process to reconnect individual with designated role
Deploy Dharma Mentorship Protocol for occupational misalignment resolution
Activate Community Integration Cycle to restore social harmony post-deviation
Engage Consciousness Reorientation Module to dissolve ego-driven occupational shifts
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands executed. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
